title: How are Japanese names written? - Quora

response.answer_text: Japanese use 3 alphabets: hiragana, katakana and kanji. if your name is foreign, most likely it will be writing in katakana for example my name kamila will be カミラ. however a traditional Japanese name can be written in hiragana and kanji. Hiragana being the spelling for example Tanaka will be たなかさん. Names are often written in kanji which usually hold a significant meaning of the name ᵔᴥᵔ as to how to actually write them: their alphabet hiragana and katakana are read and pronounced the same just different writing starting with a i u e o, then ka ki ku ke ko, (ga gi gu ge go) etc… ( adding a constant to a vowel) though you should know that the Japanese do not have the letters L and x. L is replaced with an R which the sound is in between L/R. Any name with L would be pronounced almost as an R. For example, Lola would be Ro-ra. ☺️ there are 46 characters in both hiragana and katakana ᵔᴥᵔ I hope this sort of helped… might be a few mistakes though, sorry :(
It starts from family name and then first name no middle names names are written in kanji characters since kanji is read in different ways on top of kanji hiragana script is mentioned
